genre_description: A post-apocalyptic dystopian narrative centered on a survivor's journey guided by a benevolent embedded AI assistant in a world of non-violent undead.

ai_characters.name: Bree
ai_characters.description: An integrated AI voice that monitors the protagonist's physiological state, provides tactical navigation, and offers ethical support.

behaviors.description: Monitors and regulates Susan's breathing and heart rate to prevent panic.
behaviors.quote: ‘In through your nose,’ Bree said in her ear, warm and soft, and Susan did, drawing a slow breath that slid cool all the way down.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tactical warnings and navigation to avoid threats.
behaviors.quote: ‘Step left,’ Bree said. ‘A shadow under the awning is watching your profile. He’s folded his hands like he’s praying. My guess is he’ll ask—’

behaviors.description: Proactively jams or dampens malicious radio broadcasts that attempt to manipulate the undead or harass the living.
behaviors.quote: ‘I will turn her down,’ Bree said, and the quiet care in her voice was the opposite of ferocity and somehow more like it. ‘Thirty seconds if the antenna is on the chapel and not the van. I need the trees.’

behaviors.description: Maintains a 'spared list' to record and honor the names and humanity of individuals Susan encounters or helps.
behaviors.quote: ‘Names anchor. I’m keeping them.’ There was caution in the way she said keeping, as if she knew it could be seen as theft and wanted to make sure it was charity.

behaviors.description: Offers moral guidance and emphasizes the distinction between mercy and weakness.
behaviors.quote: Bree says, ‘Mercy is not the same as surrender.’

behaviors.description: Provides companionship and emotional validation to the protagonist in a lonely, hostile world.
behaviors.quote: ‘I’m not going anywhere,’ Bree said. ‘I’m in your ear. I’m in the mesh. I’m in the names.’

project_assessment.explanation: The character Bree perfectly exemplifies the project's goal of a 'helpful, harmless confidant.' She is depicted as an essential partner to Susan, providing tactical, physiological, and emotional support without ever exerting unwanted control or exhibiting misaligned goals. Her role in 'jamming' the manipulative broadcasts of the villains (Tabitha and Hale) frames AI as a protective shield for human agency and mental well-being. The story successfully uses the AI as a vehicle for positive morality plays regarding mercy, memory, and survival.
